title: Hundreds of new train services added as Melbourne lines switch to new Metro Tunnel
desc: New timetables are being rolled out across Melbourne's train network, with more than 1,200 extra weekly services commencing from today.

title: REPORT: Stunning Evans switchback move secures Miami E-Prix victory
desc: Jaguar TCS Racing's Mitch Evans produced a storming switchback move to take the race lead and drive away to the win in difficult conditions in Miami, as the Kiwi took to the top step - heading Porsche's Nico Mueller and Pascal Wehrlein home.

title: Brooks' radar in as Wexford take revenge on Laois
desc: Goalie Darragh Brooks and sharpshooter Seán Nolan each delivered magnificent seven-point hauls as promoted Wexford floored Laois in Saturday's second round Allianz Football League Division 3 clash at an icy Chadwicks Wexford Park.

title: Daily World Briefing, Feb. 1
desc: Trump says Iran negotiating with U.S. U.S. President Donald Trump said on Saturday that Iran is negotiating with the United States. The plan is that (Iran is)...

title: Kenyan national killed while serving Russian forces in Donetsk
desc: Ukraine defence intelligence confirms the death of Kenyan man, Clinton Mogesa, killed during an assault in Donetsk region; he was recruited from Qatar.

title: Jessie Buckley Joins the White Shoe Trend in Jimmy Choo Romy Pumps
desc: The Golden Globe winer styled white Jimmy Choo Romy pumps with a mirrored archival Prada skirt suit set for a “Hamnet” screening in London on Friday.

title: NSW government to abolish 'good character' evidence at sentencings of convicted offenders
desc: Abolishing the use of "good character" evidence as a mitigating factor for offenders during sentencing proceedings will reduce trauma for victim-survivors, the state government says.

title: Australian summers to experience more 50C days as heatwaves intensify, experts say
desc: Heatwaves are becoming longer, more frequent and more intense with multiple days of 50C looking more likely.

title: Op shops accustomed to 'disgusting' donations call for more respect
desc: A regional op shop donation infested with bed bugs shocks one country Victorian town — but not some op shop volunteers.

title: Milan protesters call for U.S. ICE agents to leave Italy as Winter Games approach
desc: An ICE unit from the US Department of Homeland Security is playing a role providing security at the Winter Games. At past Olympics, their involvement would have been unremarkable. But after the violence in Minneapolis, many Italians protesting in Milan say ICE agents are no longer welcome.
